 I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָחָשׁ‎</span> **noun masculine**<sup>[[Gen.3.1|Gen 3:1]]</sup> ==serpent== (Late Hebrew id.; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***serpent, viper*** ([[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>406 anything</sup> ***hunted***) is compare by [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>M, i, 230</sup>; BN 50, 188 [[BDB#Ba|Ba]]<sup>Es 48</sup>, but improbable; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> see below [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָחַשׁ‎</span> below; on formation compare [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>BN 50</sup>); — absolute <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> [[Amos.5.19|Amos 5:19]] +; construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחַשׁ‎</span> [[Num.21.9|Num 21:9]] + 2 t.; plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחָשִׁים‎</span> [[Num.21.6|Num 21:6]]; [[Jer.8.17|Jer 8:17]] — 

**1.** ***serpent:*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** as biting, [[Amos.5.19|Amos 5:19]]; [[Eccl.10.8|Eccl 10:8]], in spite of charm (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַחַשׁ‎</span>) v[[Eccl.10.11|Eccl 10:11]] [compare Ecculs [[Eccl.12.13|Eccl 12:13]]], [[Jer.8.17|Jer 8:17]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צִפְעֹנִים‎</span>; figurative of enemies); so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַנְּחָשִׁים הַשְׁרָפִים‎</span> [[Num.21.6|Num 21:6]] (deadly; [[BDB#J|J]] [[BDB#E|E]]; compare [[BDB#Jacob|Jacob]]<sup>Arab. Dicht. iv. 10 ff.</sup>), and singular v[[Num.21.9|Num 21:9]], also (collective) v[[Num.21.7|Num 21:7]] compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׂרָף‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> [[Deut.8.15|Deut 8:15]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַקְרָב‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> figurative of oppressor, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִשֹּׁרֶשׁ נָחָשׁ יֵצֵא צֶפַע וּפִרְיוֺ שָׂרָף מְעוֺפֵף‎</span> [[Isa.14.29|Isa 14:29]] figurative of Dan [[Gen.49.17|Gen 49:17]] (poem in [[BDB#J|J]]; \|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שְׁפִיפֹן‎</span>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲמַת נ‎</span> [[Ps.58.5|Ps 58:5]] (simile of perniciousness of ungodly), compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> [[Ps.140.4|Ps 140:4]] simile of effect of wine [[Prov.22.32|Prov 22:32]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎צִפִעֹנִי‎</span>). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** rod becomes <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> [[Exod.4.3|Exod 4:3]] ([[BDB#J|J]]), compare [[Exod.7.15|Exod 7:15]] ([[BDB#E|E]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲלֵי צוּר דֶּרֶךְ נ‎</span> [[Prov.30.19|Prov 30:19]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> (apparently) as hissing [[Jer.46.22|Jer 46:22]] (in simile, compare [[BDB#Gie|Gie]]); as eating dust [[Isa.65.25|Isa 65:25]] compare [[Mic.7.17|Mic 7:17]] (in simile; see also [[Gen.3.14|Gen 3:14]]). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** as crafty tempter [[Gen.3.1|Gen 3:1]]; [[Gen.3.2|Gen 3:2]]; [[Gen.3.4|Gen 3:4]]; [[Gen.3.13|Gen 3:13]]; [[Gen.3.14|Gen 3:14]]. 

**2.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎(הַ)נְּחשֶׁת‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span>, bronze image of serpent [[Num.21.9|Num 21:9]] (twice in verse); [[2Kgs.18.4|2Kgs 18:4]] (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְחֻשְׁתָּן‎</span>). 

**3.** mythological <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּרִחַ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> [[Job.26.13|Job 26:13]] ***fleeing serpent***, of eclipse-dragon (compare<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִנְיָתָן‎</span> [[Job.3.6|Job 3:6]]); also <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בּרִחַ ֗֗֗ ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִוְיָתָן נ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עֲקַלָּתוֺן‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִוְיָתָן נ‎</span> [[Isa.27.1|Isa 27:1]] (symbolic of world-powers); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> of sea-monster [[Amos.9.3|Amos 9:3]]. — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נ‎</span> with verb <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָשַׁךְ‎</span> ***bite*** [[Num.21.6|Num 21:6]] + 8 t. On supernatural character of serpents in Arabic belief see [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>Zeitschr. Für Völkerpsychol. i.(1860), 412-416</sup> [[BDB#RS|RS]]<sup>Kinship 197, Semitic i. 421 f.</sup>, 2d ed, 442 [[BDB#We|We]]<sup>Skizzen iii.147, Arab. Heid. 2, 152 f.</sup> [[BDB#Jacob|Jacob]]<sup>Arab. Dicht. iv. 5</sup>
